Author: wmorein
Content: The conclusions of this article may not necessarily be wrong (everything gets killed eventully), but it pretty spectactularly misses the point of 20% time. The interesting part of 20% time is that it is not about what management thinks, but about how much momentum you can get on your idea yourself and with others you can attract and motivate. I don't work there, but from my understanding the idea is that mgmt can't reject an idea per se -- if you want to work on it that is your call.

Author: gojomo
Content: Yes. Of course, you lose the HD contents if you release the instance, or for other occasional failure and system events.

Author: gojomo
Content: BTW, if  want to milk your experience for attention, you could position yourself as "Mark Zuckerberg's Gary Kildall".

Author: gojomo
Content: I only read starting at p. 294, but don't think Zuckerberg came off too badly in your recounting. He was impatient, aggressive, and calculated he could do the social-network thing better on his own... and it looks like he was right.

Author: admoin
Content: It gets weirder and weirder thinking about how he's the same guy I roomed with 7 years ago at summer camp.
